gil.core
Class ProcessModelProcedure

java.lang.Object
  gil.core.ProcessModelProcedure

public class ProcessModelProcedure
extends java.lang.Object

This is the logic separated from the controlling thread to handle the communication with the process model. The method runOnce will typically be called continously from a controlling thread. The driving force of separating the controlling thread from the logic is to make the logic easily testable. Methods in this object are not thread safe unless otherwise noted.

Constructor Detail

ProcessModelProcedure

public ProcessModelProcedure(IProcessModelAdapter pmAdapter,
                             int esOperatingFrequency,
                             ITransferPipeline pipeline,
                             IntegrationContext context,
                             int valuesBufSize,
                             GILConfiguration config)
Parameters:
pmAdapter - The process model boundary class
esOperatingFrequency - The process model operating frequency in Hertz.
pipeline - The pipeline instance through which process data will be fed.
context - The context data to be shared between the ExternalSystemProceedure and the ProcessModelProcedure.
valuesBufSize - The number of bytes that must be allocated for signal values read from the process model.
config - Object containing configuration parameters to be used by this object.

getDroppedProcessModelFrames

public int getDroppedProcessModelFrames()
This method is thread safe

Returns:
the number of frames dropped caused by the process model simulator time has advanced more than a single frame between two subsequent process data reads.
